message.content:
<<<api>>>: Activity.setContentView
<<<code>>>: 
```java
gob1.setOnClickListener(new View.OnClickListener(){
    @Override
    public void onClick(View p1)
    {
        setContentView(R.layout.main);
    }
});

gob2.setOnClickListener(new View.OnClickListener(){
    @Override
    public void onClick(View p1)
    {
        setContentView(R.layout.main);
    }
});

lb.setOnClickListener(new View.OnClickListener(){
    @Override
    public void onClick(View p1)
    {
        setContentView(R.layout.learn);
    }
});

plb.setOnClickListener(new View.OnClickListener(){
    @Override
    public void onClick(View p1)
    {
        setContentView(R.layout.main);
    }
});

prb.setOnClickListener(new View.OnClickListener(){
    @Override
    public void onClick(View p1)
    {
        setContentView(R.layout.main);
    }
});
```
<<<explanation>>>: The crash is caused by a NullPointerException at line 28 in your MainActivity.java file. This means that you are trying to call a method or access a property of an object that hasn't been initialized (it's null). In your case, it seems like one of the buttons (gob1, gob2, lb, plb, prb) is null when you are trying to set an onClickListener on it. Make sure that you have correctly initialized these buttons before setting the onClickListener. The setContentView method is used to set the activity layout, it doesn't seem to be the cause of the crash.
